text:
Hi everyone !
I have a simple question, maybe somebody already faced this issue.
Does HubSpot (with Workflow) have a way to know when an object is associate with another or unassociated ? I want to trigger a custom code when a Deal is unassociated with another object..
Thank you for your help !

If I already have an api secondary domain established in my HubSpot account and my developer wants to attach another IP address to it for website page calls, is that possible or do I need to create a new domain?
You can create a calculated property for number of asscociated objects and then trigger based on when that property changes
Oh wow, I didn't know we could do that, thank you so much, again, for your help ! :slightly_smiling_face:

hi everyone - I have a questions on multiple owners for contacts/companies/deals. I set up the "Additional Owner" custom property (using hubspt user delineation) for each group - contacts, company, deals, then updated the field for a bdr who is working the same accounts as a rep about to go on maternity. he has access to log notes and see things, but cant add an activity - any reason why not? I have checked user permissions - i even made him the lead on their 2 person "team" and still nothing - log out/log in etc....thanks !

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
What Channel should I go to to ask for python coding questions?
Depends what you're doing, is it API related? Then probably <#C2YHAHB6K|api>
Happy International Women's Day to those that identify as women in the Dev Slack! We hope to see more of you in 2023 and beyond :female-technologist:

hey all - quick Q;
Can start building myself, but does anyone have a fully functional example of the following for use within a custom code segment of a workflow?

• deduplicate by phone (that works!) which merges into the oldest record if multiple exist
• get company domain from company email (then deduplicate)
have some _enthusiastic_ team members who have imported around 2 million records
trying to get a hang on this before it gets _more_ out of hand

Yeah I have the first one, but the second one I don't have but is pretty simple to write. Basically you just want to split the an email address, get the domain, then search for a contact using that domain and contact name. Correct?

On thing I will mention though is that you'll run into rate limits pretty quickly if you're trying to do 2 million records at one time, the first example requires a contact search api call (4/second) and a merge call (10/second). So you're pretty limited. You'll have to enroll contacts in batches
